jobs.title: Lead User Researcher (Freelance or Permanent)
jobs.description:
At Wevat, we believe in the value of user research in developing a great service for our users. We want to embed research into every part of our process and be guided by the needs of our users to find the best design solutions and influence the change of government policy to make getting tax refunds simpler and easier.

The role

We're looking for an experienced user researcher to lead our research strategy and conduct a wide range of research to help us to develop a deep understanding of our users. We are flexible and open for you to join on a permanent or freelance basis.

As the Lead User Researcher you will plan and lead user research activities for our tax refund service. You will build user-centred practices, and plan and conduct user research across multiple projects with wider plans to inform our product and service proposition. You will work closely with our lead designer, engineering, marketing and customer support teams, as well as the founders of the company.

Main responsibilities

* Planning, designing and preparing a range of user research activities to inform the value proposition, support the design, development and continuous improvement of the end-to-end service journey, from online to offline
* Carrying out a wide range of user research activities from recruiting participants, preparing discussion guides and moderating research sessions

* Leading team members to analyse research data and synthesise clear and actionable findings, including using analytics data to create a rich picture of user behaviour
* Communicating user research findings to build a deep understanding of users and their needs
* Working with the lead designer to produce a service blueprint, journey maps and personas
* Involving the team and stakeholders throughout the research process
* Working closely with the lead designer and engineering team to turn user research findings into stories and actions that lead to valuable product and service features
* Develop and track research learnings over time

Requirements

* Experience with a wide range of research methodologies, tools and approaches and a keen understanding of when to use which according to product/service lifecycle. From usability testing, observation and contextual interview to diary study, remote testing and surveys.
* Strong mix of both qualitative and quantitative methodologies
* Ability to adjust research tasks based on timing and budget
* Experience of advocating for user research and engaging and educating sceptical colleagues and stakeholders
* Experience of helping teams to adopt user-centred service design and delivery practices and embed them into their current workflow
* The ability to understand the complex problems a team is trying to solve, and align user research activities to inform decision-making and actions
* Proven experience of introducing new user research methods into a team, and guiding colleagues in the choice and effective application of research methods
* The ability to include all kinds of users in appropriate research activities to help teams understand the diversity of users.
* Excellent in communicating research findings effectively
* Good knowledge in design principles, usability heuristics and service design
* High comfort level working in a self-directed environment and navigating ambiguity

Bonus experience

* A solid academic background from a behaviour field, such as psychology, HCI, social research and anthropology
* Experience of conducting research with international users (ideally Chinese)

Benefits

* Competitive salary and equity options in the company
* Tech equipment of your choice
* Regular socials, including team meals and drinks, as well as two company retreats a year (last one was in Portugal!)
* £100 a month budget for food and drink
* Budget for coaching / mentoring, learning and development
* Dog-friendly office – we're in Campfire Shoreditch
